nodes.bodyText: -1 can be used to represent NO_OFFSET, will that cause a problem here?
I think we should only use recordsAfterOffset. Offset is useless. See comments in CheckpointedPosition.
I wasn't using offset for my Hive source PoC. Honestly, I don't quite understand the difference between offset and recordsAfterOffset. Could you elaborate on these and how should they be used?
I think make sense to use offset as a binary offset. Otherwise, it looks strange.
It is necessary, It is possible to read only half of the batch data.
I meant we can simply call skipRecord(records) here. It checks recordsToSkip > 0 by itself, no?
This can be improved when it takes a Split in the create/restore method, not just the path and position. Then we can get partition directly.
